p.n: Sammy Price and his All Star Orchestra
p.k: Texan pianist Sammy Price (1908-1992) played everything from blues and boogie-woogie to swing and jump-blues. Starting in Dallas as a singer and dancer

p.n: Fred Hersch Trio - Jazz a Ramatuelle
p.k: At the age of 63, Fred Hersch is unquestionably one of today's key figures in jazz piano. Supported by John Hebert (double bass) and Eric McPherson

p.n: Chet Baker Quintet: Live in '64
p.k: Chet Baker was the interpreter of West Coast jazz in the early and mid-'50s. Baker had a generally restrained, intimate playing style and attracted

p.n: Dion with Henri Segers and his orchestra
p.k: One of the most popular American rock & roll performers of the days before the Beatles, Dion's music spans everything from doo-wop, rock and R&B to straight blues. (1963)

n.u: Sarah Vaughan: Jazz from Newport, Brussels

p.n: Sarah Vaughan: Jazz from Newport, Brussels 1973
p.k: For the second of two appearances at the 1973 Jazz from Newport Festival in Brussels, Sarah Vaughan and her trio consisting of Carl Schroeder (piano)

p.n: Makiko Hirabayashi Trio - jazzahead!
p.k: Makiko Hirabayashi Trio represents the Danish jazz scene on jazzahead! 2019. Led by the Japanese pianist Makiko Hirabayashi, the trio blends

p.n: Paul Heller / Jasper Van't Hof Group - jazzahead!
p.k: Paul Heller and Jasper Van't Hof Group is a classic jazz quartet: tenor saxophone, piano, double bass and drums. Combining energetic spontaneity

p.n: Jazz Open Stuttgart: West Coast All Stars
p.k: This live recording is celebrating 50 years of West Coast Jazz. The West Coast Jazz movement had its origins about 50 years ago in Los Angeles

p.n: Elliot Galvin Trio - November Music
p.k: The pianist Elliot Galvin is a member of the young UK jazz group Dinosaur. Performing with his own trio, the gifted musician has been compared to Django

p.n: BIRDtv: Myles Sanko
p.k: This episode of BIRD.tv (2015) presents the London-based French-Ghanian soul jazz singer Myles Sanko (.1980). His exceptional voice, his lyrics

p.n: Seine Sessions: World Music
p.k: This episode of Seine Sessions 'World Music', presented by Eddy King, shows unique performances and interviews of among Teófilo Chantre, Tiwitine and Kinsy Ray

p.n: Trio Chemirani: Dawâr
p.k: The veritable tombak virtuosos of Trio Chemirani, consisting of Chemirani Senior and Juniors, enrapture the Festival de Saintes. The Trio Chemirani's music

p.n: Buzz Bros Band - Same New Story
Tel Aviv Sessions: Avi Lebovich Orchestra
p.k: The legendary Yellow Submarine Jazz Club in Jerusalem presents trombonist Avi Lebovich and his Orchestra. The Orchestra is a contemporary incarnation

p.n: International Jazz Quintette de Jaspar et Thomas
p.k: The International Jazz Quintet led by guitarist René Thomas (1926-1975) and saxophonist Bobby Jaspar (1926-1963) is highly underrated. Enjoy this concert

p.n: Teus Nobel live at the Bimhuis: Legacy
p.k: Teus Nobel is a Dutch trumpet and flugelhorn player. Teus dedicates his compositions to his all-time heroes Jarmo Hoogendijk, Woody Shaw, Christian Scott

p.n: Tigran Hamasyan & Mathias Eick - November Music
p.k: In 2019, Armenian pianist Tigran Hamasyan and Norwegian trumpeter Mathias Eick played a duo performance at November Music in 's-Hertogenbosch, the Netherlands

p.n: Keita, Tinariwen Maal & Sangare: Africa Live!
The Garifuna Collektive - WOMEX 2018
p.k: In 2018, WOMEX was held in Las Palmas, Gran Canaria. One of its showcase participants, The Garifuna Collective, carries the legacy of Andy Palacio

p.n: AJOYO - jazzahead!
p.k: Brooklyn-based band AJOYO is the brainchild of multi-reed player Yacine Boulares. Their music is a mystic brew of African tradition, jazz and soul

p.n: Lisbon Underground Music Ensemble - jazzahead!
p.k: Lisbon Underground Music Ensemble (L.U.M.E.) is a musical project by composer Marco Barroso. The 15-piece group is inspired by the big band tradition

p.n: Christian Scott - Jazz a Vienne 2017
p.k: Christian Scott aTunde Adjuah blends jazz fusion, hip-hop and alternative rock, developing a unique and distinct sound. Scott's performance

n.u: Tania Maria: Live at Estival Lugano

p.n: Tania Maria: Live at Estival Lugano 1987
p.k: This performance of Brazilian Tania Maria promises to make you want to dance. The singer, composer and pianist sets fire to the Estival scene with her pop and jazzy song

p.n: Jeff Moran & Thomas Carbou live a Quebec
p.k: Trumpeter Jacques Kuba Séguin's ensemble unites some of Montreal's most expressive musicians: double bassist Frédéric Alarie, pianist Jonathan Cayer
